newsitem.title: EGYPT: Italian PM meets Egypt's Mubarak on Mideast peace.
newsitem.headline: Italian PM meets Egypt's Mubarak on Mideast peace.

text.p: Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi held talks on Monday with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak on how to boost Europe's role in the Middle East peace process.

Prodi, on his first visit to the region since he was elected in May, told reporters after arriving on Sunday that Europe wanted a greater role in the peace process in parallel to the peace efforts of the United States.

"I think that Europe, we play quietly and slowly an increasingly important role. Not, of course, as an antagonist to the U.S. role," Prodi told reporters after meeting Arab League Secretary General Esmat Abdel-Meguid.
Italy is the former head of the 15-nation European Union's rotating presidency and Egypt, a main regional political player, has hosted many rounds of Palestinian-Israeli peace talks.
The Italian prime minister's visit is part of a flurry of diplomatic efforts by the European Union to enlarge its role in the peace talks, co-sponsored by the United States.
Arabs have traditionally seen the U.S. role in the Middle East as favouring Israeli interests.
